title: How to get 95% in class 10 within 2 months - Quora
tags: Central Board of Secondary Education, India

response.answer_text: It is not possible to score more than 95% in only 2 months. If you can study 14 to 15 hrs a day then only it is possible to score more than 85%. And also scoring doesn't depends on how much hours you study it depends on how you are understanding the topics. See if you want to score good the follow the following instructions Read and understand your class notes and textbooks.Start solving question papers like previous year or sample question papers of oswaal.Be confident in yourself and study wiselyIt's up to you how you study.

yes, it is possible just focus on your studies be sure you are putting your efforts in right direction. Take a break of 5-10 min. After every 45 minutes. Else your concentration will start to decrease. Now as only 2 months are left try solving sample papers and previous years questions. And please don't stop playing and using social networking sites just reduce the time you give on them but make sure that you do both daily.

[1] Yes! Two months is good lot of time for preparing for your exam. Make sure you study at least 3 hours a day with sufficient breaks, eat healthy food, make a timetable, solve old question papers an refer question banks. Use techniques like mind palace to improve your memory skills. Make a small note book for all subjects where you make a note of important points or points that are though to remember. Also underline things that you forget in your notebook or textbook. Check the link I've added to improve your reading. All the best! Footnotes[1] 11 Secrets to Memorize Things Quicker Than Others

Yes why not!! Read and command a hold on NCERTs of every nook and corner. NCERTs are your bible. Understand concepts and their applications. Practice from various sources- guides or online, anything! Keep practising all the previous papers. Hard work with smart plans will get you even better than 95%. Good luck champ! If there is anything I can help you, feel free to message. :)

If you are aiming for 95%, then why not 99%. The extra error margins that you give yourself would affect your performance at the examination. Focus on what you have to study through important questions and sample papers and practice them for the last 2 months for all your subjects. If you do your job efficiently, you would get more than you expect. This worked for me and has worked for many of my friends. Hence the suggestion.
You have to go through your notes which are mainly required for your boards. Go through all your test papers book of all subjects.
